name: agent
description: Messaging-driven LLM agent with Telegram integration
usage:
Creates a VM running an LLM agent that receives messages via tether or Telegram and responds with streaming text.

Built-in tools: bash, file ops (read/write/edit/glob/grep), web_search, image_search, image_generate, web_fetch, respond_with_image, memory (store/search/delete with auto-injection), cron (scheduled tasks), self_restart, self_info. MCP tools for VM orchestration (spawn/list/stop child instances, expose ports, keepalive).

Profiles:
- Lightweight (default): python:3.12-alpine, 512MB. Built-in tools + Python for app development. Covers 90% of use cases.
  instance_start with kit="agent", name="my-agent", secrets=["OPENAI_API_KEY"]
- Heavy (Chrome MCP, Node-based MCP servers): override with image="node:22-alpine" and memory_mb=2048.
  instance_start with kit="agent", name="browser-agent", image="node:22-alpine", memory_mb=2048, secrets=["OPENAI_API_KEY"]

Quick start (tether only):
1. Check available secrets with secret_list
2. Start: instance_start with kit="agent", name="my-agent", secrets=["OPENAI_API_KEY"]
3. Send messages via tether_send, read responses via tether_read

With Telegram gateway:
1. Set secrets: secret_set OPENAI_API_KEY and TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN
2. Start: instance_start with kit="agent", name="my-agent", secrets=["OPENAI_API_KEY", "TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN"]
3. Create gateway config at ~/.aegis/kits/my-agent/gateway.json:
   {"telegram":{"bot_token_secret":"TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN","allowed_chats":["*"]}}
4. The gateway starts automatically and picks up the config within seconds

The agent VM pauses when idle and wakes on new messages. Workspace is auto-created if not specified.

Required secrets: OPENAI_API_KEY (or ANTHROPIC_API_KEY)
Optional secrets: TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN, BRAVE_SEARCH_API_KEY (web/image search)
Optional env: AEGIS_SYSTEM_PROMPT (custom system prompt)
